channel.title: cleanup on Edoardo Tenani
channel.description: Recent content in cleanup on Edoardo Tenani

item.title: Bring out the trash!
item.description: I recently stumbled upon the usual issue with all my development machines: “no space left on device”. As it happens frequently, I had to spin up the trusted disk analyser, Baobab and dig into it. Something was filling up my 512GB disk, but exactly what? My home folder Well, that wasn’t that suprising, but: My Trash was 31.2GB! I used asdf to manage programming language interpreter/runtimes, this was taking ~30GB, 24 of them being taken by Golang installations and relative packages My code folder, where I keep all code I’ve been hacking/working on, was ~24GB ⛰ Massive!
